chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael L Jones was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:32 PM Defendant Michael L Jones in court, in custody, by zoom from Jackson Correctional with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 2
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 2. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 1 and 3. 
Court dismisses by operation of law count 4. 

Court dismisses and reads in case 16CM153. 

Court orders the following:
20 DAYS  in the waukesha county jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
90 DAYS CREDIT
TIME SERVED

FINE: $ 1229.00
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

D/L REVOCATION: 13 months;
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 13 months;

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Any monies posted in this matter or in 16CM153 are to be applied to any fine/fee/surcharges in this matter.   Civil judgment to enter on the remaining fees.
